body_html:
When using TF, you should always use import tensorflow as tf
Then use tf.keras.
You may define shortcuts such as keras = tf.keras

TF public API guarantees only apply when you do import tensorflow.
Any other import statements are outside of TF public python API guarantees.
body_text:
When using TF, you should always use import tensorflow as tf
Then use tf.keras.
You may define shortcuts such as keras = tf.keras
TF public API guarantees only apply when you do import tensorflow.
Any other import statements are outside of TF public python API guarantees.
body:
When using TF, you should always use `import tensorflow as tf`
Then use `tf.keras`.
You may define shortcuts such as `keras = tf.keras`

TF public API guarantees only apply when you do `import tensorflow`.
Any other import statements are outside of TF public python API guarantees.
